content: I have made changes to my `.bashrc` file and I want those changes to take effect without logging out and back in. How can I reload the `.bashrc` settings to achieve this?

To apply the changes made to your `.bashrc` file without logging out and back in, you can simply reload it in your current terminal session. You can do this by using the `source` command or by using a dot (`.`) which is a shorthand for the `source` command. Here’s how you can do it:

1. Open your terminal.

2. Run either of the following commands:

   ```bash
   source ~/.bashrc
   ```

   or

   ```bash
   . ~/.bashrc
   ```

This will execute the `.bashrc` file and apply any changes you’ve made to your current session.
